thread.title: Harry Kane injury leaves Tottenham with fingers crossed that his season ISN'T actually over
thread.title_full: Harry Kane injury leaves Tottenham with fingers crossed that his season ISN'T actually over

author: Darren Lewis
title: Harry Kane injury leaves Tottenham with fingers crossed that his season ISN'T actually over
text:
Sport Harry Kane injury leaves Tottenham with fingers crossed that his season ISN'T actually over The club are braced for a seven- to eight-week layoff — which could see the striker back for their last few games Share Spurs fans are desperate for Kane to be fit for the final games of their top-four chase (Photo: AFP/Getty Images/PA Wire) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Spurs are clinging to the hope that Harry Kane will play again before the end of the season. 
The England striker will have a scan on Wednesday to discover the full extent of the ankle injury he suffered in Sunday’s FA Cup quarter-final win over Millwall. 
The results are expected over the subsequent 24 hours, with Tottenham — scrapping with Manchester City, Arsenal, Liverpool and Manchester United over the three Champions League qualifying places behind ruanway leaders Chelsea — braced for a lay-off of around seven to eight weeks, meaning he'd be out until early May. This challenge from Millwall defender Jake Cooper... (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) ...ended Kane's FA Cup quarter-final after only 10 minutes (Photo: Getty Images) 
But they are hopeful that Kane could be back for at least the final two games of the season — at home against Man United on May 13, and away to Hull a week later. 
Kane injured his right ankle in a challenge with Millwall defender Jake Cooper. 
Tottenham have been waiting for the swelling on his ankle to go down before sending him for scans. 
Kane suffered a similar injury to the same ankle on September 24, at home to Sunderland, and was back in action six weeks and one day later in the north London derby against Arsenal — scoring from the penalty spot in that match. Spurs lost Kane to a similar ankle injury on September 24... (Photo: Getty) ...and he returned, with a goal, on November 6 (Photo: REUTERS) 
Team-mate Eric Dier believes the club proved on Sunday that they can cope without Kane. 
Following the marksman’s exit, Son Heung Min hit a hat-trick while Christian Eriksen, Dele Alli and Vincent Janssen all scored in a 6-0 win. 
Dier said: “Obviously Harry is very important for us, a big part of this team in many ways. I don’t know how bad it is. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
